result.execSummary:
The defendant Shelly A Monroe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to 20CM136 and to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $100 fine plus court costs including Department of Corrections supervision fees. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
-----------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-----------------------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent. 
-----------------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shelly A Monroe

records.addlTxt: Letters from DOC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure

Defendant Shelly A Monroe in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Shelly A Monroe. Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. BFH canceled. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Plea is freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made. Defendant does not make statement. Court gives warning to deportation. Minutes filed.
Status conference not called on the record. No ASL interpreter. Reset to 5-27-2022.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND TO COVER 22CM22, 20CM136, AND 21CM403

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH R.E.J. dob 2-18-1959 OR P.D.S. dob 2-6-1962.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Shelly A Monroe appeared in court. Attorney Keith Venema appeared. Interpreter Kim Ramsay previously sworn by clerk, appeared via zoom. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Last status no agreement, set for trial. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shelly A Monroe in court with attorney Keith Kolby Venema.  Samuel Thomas Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter was not available today, asking for 2 weeks. Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
